intro: Sida physocalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along waterways. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Sida physocalyx is known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
